page.title: 07LUDFORD _ SUMMARY
page.content: A Linear Village along A631 Rotherham to Louth road, 80% of village being in this Grid area. Main street,Magna Mile follows this road and is the line of Ancient Salters Way, a Trans Wolds trackway from Salt Pans at Grainthorpe to Lincoln. The Viking Way Footpath from Oakham, Rutland to the Humber follows this route and is used by many walkers. Village nestles in dip on top of Wolds and from adjacent heights appears well wooded but this is an illusion, many trees having been fell_ _ed for wartime airfield so that cold winds prevail. River Bain rises in Ludford and is mentioned in the late Poet Laureate, John Betjeman's poem 'A Lincolnshire Tale'. The Church, School & a Pub are in next Grid area_ Page 7. A compact community of just over 300 with local small firms providing jobs & there is good social activity.
